Package org.jpedal.examples.viewer.commands.javafx

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    JavaFXCopy
    Copies the text a user has selected/highlighted.
    JavaFXDocInfo
    Shows a Message Dialogue displaying the Documents Information.
    JavaFXExit
    Clean up and exit program
    JavaFXExtractSelectionAsImage
    This class is a JavaFX specific class to hold the JavaFX code for Extracting the drawn CursorBox as an Image.
    JavaFXExtractText
    Class to Handle the popup dialogs created when user right clicks highlighted text and chooses text extraction.
    JavaFXFullScreen
    Toggles between FullScreen.
    JavaFXHelp
    This class will load a Pop-Up which points the user to our Support and Documentation section on our website.
    JavaFXInfo
    This class displays a popup window which gives user information about JPedal.
    JavaFXMouseModeCommand
    This Class Toggles Between Text Selection and Pan Mode for the ToolBar Toggle Button.
    JavaFXOpenFile
    This class Opens up a new file on page one whilst still using the users chosen settings, it first handles unsaved forms and resets the viewable area, it decodes the PDF and finally opens the new document.
    JavaFXPageNavigator
    This class controls the different methods that allow you to navigate a document by page, its critical method is navigatePages()
    JavaFXPanMode
    This Class Enables PanMode when activated via the top drop-down menu, When PanMode is enabled, Snapshot and TextSelect functionality is disabled.
    JavaFXPreferences
    This Class Sets Up and Displays the Preference Window Which Allows the User to Customise their JavaFX PDF Viewer Experience.
    JavaFXPrint  
    JavaFXRSSyndication
    When the RSS button on the viewer is called it will load the stage with the link for the RSS Feed to join.
    JavaFXSaveFile
    This class displays a dialog which allows the user to save their PDF file as either .pdf or .fdf.
    JavaFXScaling
    This class controls how the viewer content is scaled, It can be scaled by either a set percentage or by width/height/page, The main scaling is performed depending on the index variable value in the scaleAndRotate method in either JavaFXGUI/SwingGUI.
    JavaFXTextSelect
    This Class Enables TextSelectionMode when activated via the top drop-down menu, When TextSelectionMode is enabled, PanMode functionality is disabled.
    JavaFXTipOfTheDay
    Class Which Displays the Tip of the Day Can be toggle to display on Viewer Startup.
